publicly disagreeing with and criticizing your government or political party: a dissident group/writer
More examplesFewer examplesThis new policy will ensure those dissident voices and others will be heard without undermining our sanctions policy.He was a dissident candidate of the Liberal Party. But Democrats and dissident Republicans have been successful on a handful of key votes.I don't easily obey. I won't say I am dissident, but I am honest and speak out.

politics & government a person who strongly disagrees with and publicly criticizes a government or the official rulings of a group or organization: Union dissidents have challenged the leadership of the current president. dissident adjective [ not gradable ] us
